term: Endrew F. v. Douglas County School District

metadata.notes: 2017 Supreme Court case that clarified the FAPE standard under IDEA

term: Endrew F. v. Douglas County School District RE-1
definition: Supreme Court case establishing that schools must offer an IEP reasonably calculated to enable a child to make progress appropriate in light of the child's circumstances

metadata.notes: 1982 landmark case that first defined FAPE and established the two-part Rowley test

term: Board of Education of Hendrick Hudson Central School District v. Rowley
definition: landmark Supreme Court case establishing that FAPE requires procedural compliance and educational benefit, but not the best possible education

term: Burlington School Committee v. Department of Education

metadata.notes: 1985 case establishing parents' right to reimbursement for private school tuition when schools fail to provide FAPE

term: School Committee of Burlington v. Department of Education
definition: Supreme Court case establishing that parents may be reimbursed for private school costs when a school fails to provide FAPE and the private placement is appropriate

term: Florence County School District v. Carter

metadata.notes: 1993 case expanding Burlington by allowing reimbursement even for schools not meeting state approval requirements

term: Florence County School District Four v. Carter
definition: Supreme Court case holding that parents can receive tuition reimbursement for private schools even if the school lacks state approval, if it provides appropriate education

metadata.notes: 1988 case establishing the stay-put provision and limits on disciplining students with disabilities

definition: Supreme Court case establishing that schools cannot unilaterally exclude students with disabilities for behavior related to their disability and must maintain current placement during disputes

term: Cedar Rapids Community School District v. Garret F.

metadata.notes: 1999 case requiring schools to provide intensive medical services as related services

term: Cedar Rapids Community School District v. Garret F.
definition: Supreme Court case requiring schools to provide continuous nursing services as a related service if needed for a student to attend school

term: Irving Independent School District v. Tatro

metadata.notes: 1984 case establishing the medical services exception for related services

term: Irving Independent School District v. Tatro
definition: Supreme Court case establishing that schools must provide medical services that can be performed by a nurse or trained layperson as related services

metadata.notes: 2005 case establishing that the burden of proof in due process hearings lies with the party seeking relief

definition: Supreme Court case establishing that the burden of proof in administrative hearings challenging IEPs is on the party seeking relief, typically the parents

term: Winkelman v. Parma City School District

metadata.notes: 2007 case establishing parents' independent rights under IDEA to represent themselves in federal court

term: Winkelman v. Parma City School District
definition: Supreme Court case establishing that parents have independent rights under IDEA and may represent themselves in federal court without an attorney

term: Forest Grove School District v. T.A.

metadata.notes: 2009 case allowing tuition reimbursement even when students never received special education services from the public school

term: Forest Grove School District v. T.A.
definition: Supreme Court case allowing parents to seek tuition reimbursement for private special education services even when the child never received special education from the public school

term: Daniel R.R. v. State Board of Education

metadata.notes: 5th Circuit case establishing the two-part test for LRE determinations

term: Daniel R.R. v. State Board of Education
definition: Fifth Circuit case establishing a two-part test for LRE: whether education in regular classroom can be achieved satisfactorily with supplementary aids, and if not, whether mainstreaming has been to the maximum extent appropriate

metadata.notes: 3rd Circuit case establishing factors for LRE analysis and presumption toward inclusion

definition: Third Circuit case establishing that schools must consider the full range of supplementary aids and services before removing a student from regular education and must justify more restrictive placements

metadata.notes: West Virginia case holding individual teachers personally liable for failing to implement IEP accommodations

definition: West Virginia case establishing that individual teachers can be held personally liable under Section 1983 for failing to implement required IEP accommodations

term: Timothy W. v. Rochester School District

metadata.notes: 1st Circuit case establishing that all children with disabilities are entitled to education regardless of severity

term: Timothy W. v. Rochester School District
definition: First Circuit case establishing that IDEA's zero reject principle means all children with disabilities are entitled to education, regardless of the severity of their disabilities

metadata.notes: 3rd Circuit case establishing the snapshot rule for evaluating IEP appropriateness

term: Polk v. Central Susquehanna Intermediate Unit 16
definition: Third Circuit case establishing that IEP appropriateness should be judged prospectively based on information available at the time it was developed, not in hindsight

term: Greer v. Rome City School District

metadata.notes: 11th Circuit case establishing factors for LRE analysis similar to Daniel R.R.

term: Greer v. Rome City School District
definition: Eleventh Circuit case establishing a four-factor test for LRE determinations, including educational benefits, non-academic benefits, effect on other students, and cost

term: Deal v. Hamilton County Board of Education

metadata.notes: 6th Circuit case addressing graduation requirements and diploma standards for students with disabilities

term: Deal v. Hamilton County Board of Education
definition: Sixth Circuit case establishing that schools cannot deny diplomas to students with disabilities who complete their IEP requirements, even if they don't meet standard graduation requirements

metadata.notes: 1972 D.C. case that helped establish the right to education for children with disabilities

term: Mills v. Board of Education of District of Columbia
definition: landmark 1972 case establishing that children with disabilities cannot be excluded from public education and must receive due process before any change in educational status

term: Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children v. Commonwealth

metadata.notes: 1971 consent decree establishing education rights for children with intellectual disabilities in Pennsylvania

term: Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children v. Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
definition: landmark 1971 consent decree establishing that children with intellectual disabilities have a right to free public education and cannot be excluded from school

metadata.notes: 2017 Supreme Court case clarifying when IDEA exhaustion is required for Section 504 and ADA claims

definition: Supreme Court case establishing that IDEA exhaustion is not required when the gravamen of the complaint seeks relief for denial of equal access rather than denial of FAPE
